methodology:
Here is an example:
— Game companies avoid sharing their game data with external researchers. Only a few research groups have been granted limited access to game data so far. The reluctance of these companies to make data publicly available limits the wide use and development of data mining techniques and artificial intelligence research specific to the game industry. In this work, we developed and implemented an international competition on game data mining using commercial game log data from one of the major game companies in South Korea: NCSOFT. Our approach enabled researchers to develop and apply state-of-the-art data mining techniques to game log data by making the data open. Game artificial intelligence (AI) competition platforms help researchers access well-defined benchmarking problems to evaluate different algorithms, test new approaches, and educate students [1]. Since the early 2000s, considerable effort has focused on designing and running new game AI competitions using mathematical, board, video, and physical games [2]. Despite a few exceptions, most of

 The Results section should include the research question or problem that guided the study, the methods used to collect and analyze data, the results of the analysis, and conclusions drawn from the findings. It is important to present the results in a logical sequence using tables, graphs, or text, and to provide a clear explanation of any statistical analyses performed. The Results section should be concise and highlight the most important findings of the study.

 Use headings to separate sections and subheadings to break up the text into smaller chunks. Include a title page with your name, institution, and date of submission. Proofread carefully to ensure that there are no spelling or grammar errors.
